title: Oregon Territory 2014 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: A separate label produced by Paul O'Brien winery, this is a stunning value in an Oregon Pinot Noir. In total, 20% of the fruit was sourced from the Willamette Valley, and all was barrel aged for a year in 15% new French oak. The pleasing toasty scents speak of a far pricier wine, and follow up with graceful, immaculate strawberry fruit. It's balanced out against proportionate acids and tannins, and is truly delicious for near term enjoyment.

title: Quady North 2013 G-S-M (Applegate Valley)
description: The proportions here are 45% Grenache, 35% Syrah and 20% Mourvèdre, delivering an aromatic smorgasbord of spicy, herbal red fruits, pine needles, green peppercorns and some finishing funk. For the price this delivers a full blast of sensory overload, with the lushness of a CdP.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2013 Sous Blagny Premier Cru  (Meursault)
description: This is a smooth, soft wine with good apple and pear fruit. Restrained wood supports the ripeness and the lightly mineral texture. From one of the line of great premier crus in the appellation, it is likely to age well. Drink from 2019.

title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
description: A ripe rich wine from a very fine Port year, this is full of dark fruits as well as a dense texture and richness. It has kept plenty of fresh fruit and acidity that is balanced by the sweetness and final hint of spirit. Drink now and until 2026.

title: Shale Oak 2014 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe Anjou pear, crisp lime, lemongrass, squeezed tangerine and apple blossom aromas show on this quite delicious and bright wine. There is a sizzling level of acidity throughout the sip, which offers lime, scratched grapefruit skin and tart apple flavors. A racy style done well.

title: Réva 2012  Barolo
description: Camphor, menthol and blue-flower aromas slowly emerge in the glass. The extremely ripe palate offers raspberry jam, cherry marinated in spirits, white pepper and a licorice note alongside assertive, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Rijckaert 2013 Les Vercherres Vieilles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)
description: In the north of the appellation, this parcel of 50-year-old vines has produced a round, smooth and creamy wine. Yellow fruits and the slightest touch of oxidation as well as the wood flavors give a rich wine freshened by final lemon acidity.

title: Rivetti Massimo 2013 Froi  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with aromas of espresso, leather, exotic spice and black plum. The chewy palate presents juicy black cherry, licorice and chopped mint alongside solid, well-integrated tannins. Drink 2017–2022.

title: Roadhouse Winery 2014 Gold Label 777 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from the Dijon clone called 777, this wine is pretty on the nose, floral in black pepper and clove, a solid, softly textured effort from two vineyards, Leras and Pleasant Hill. Forested in pine, dried herb and cola, it closes out in round waves of juicy acidity.

title: Roadhouse Winery 2014 Green Label Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light and spicy, this deceptively robust, ripe cherry-cola wine lingers in acidity and a roundness of tannin that makes it both lush and plush, yet balanced. The oak is supportive without being intrusive.

title: Van Ruiten 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Loads of ripe fruit flavor, scads of fine-grained tannins for texture, and a sense of depth with complexity make this a wine to seek out. It's full bodied, dry, very bold but also well balanced for the long haul. Drink after 2019.

title: W. & J. Graham's NV The Tawny  (Port)
description: With strong wood flavors this is a wine that shows some good aging. It has spice, toffee and a rich texture. The wine is full, rich, mature and balanced.

title: Tapiz 2012 Selección de Barricas Reserve San Pablo Vineyard Red (Valle de Uco)
description: Licorice, raisin and ripe, loamy black-fruit aromas open this blend that's heavy on Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Slightly jammy and flat in feel, this tastes ripe and soft, with lightly herbal blue-fruit flavors. A smooth, jammy finish indicates that this is ready to drink.
designation: Selección de Barricas Reserve San Pablo Vineyard

title: Sanford 2015 Estate Grown Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Yet another example of the increasingly strong crop of rosé wines in recent vintages, this light-pink wine shows puréed strawberry and Big League Chew bubblegum aromas on the appealing nose. It's a lively wine on the palate, thanks to lime zest-powered acidity, with crisp pluot and just-ripe plum flavors as well as a touch more bubblegum.

title: Y Rousseau 2015 Rosé of Tannat (Solano County)
description: This light copper-colored, bright-tasting and dry wine made from Tannat grapes smells like watermelon and peaches, tastes fresh and lively and has a tangy texture. It was made in a serious style that will taste great with grilled seafood, gazpacho or tuna tartare.

title: Tikal 2013 Amorio Malbec-Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)
description: Floral, grapy aromas are exotic and herbal. High acidity creates energy but also a shearing sense. Currant, red plum and spice flavors end with a blast of blazing acidity and notes of baking spices, cocoa and herbs.

title: Domaine Boyar 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Thracian Valley)
description: This garnet-colored Bulgarian Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of black cherry and wet river rock. In the mouth, there are flavors of black plum, black cherry and a touch of graphite before the smooth tannic finish.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Quinta das Setencostas Red (Alenquer)
description: From a small sub-region of Lisboa, this stylish, structured wine is firm and tannic. It has plenty of ripe berry fruit to balance the tannins as well as acidity that cuts through the richness of the wine. It is ready to drink.

title: Cascina Ballarin 2012 Bussia  (Barolo)
description: Underbrush, grilled porcini, roasted herb and menthol emerge in the glass. The medium-bodied, structured palate is initially closed but eventually reveals dark berry, white pepper, sage and orange zest alongside clenched tannins. It closes on a licorice note.

title: Château de Santenay 2014  Meursault
description: Full and round, this wine is fruity while smooth and rich. A layer of crisp acidity is surrounded by the generous white and yellow fruits, accented by a touch of toast and spice. Drink this wine from 2018.

title: Château de Santenay 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Mercurey)
description: Ripe and juicy, this dense wine offers red-fruit flavors shot through with acidity. The old vines give depth to the rich wine that finishes with layers of bright fruit. Drink from 2018.

title: Aveleda 2015 Quinta da Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)
description: This blend of the two classic grapes of Vinho Verde, Loureiro and Alvarinho, is packed with fruit. Apples, lemons and a touch of ripe pear just fill the palate. It is a dry wine, refreshing and crisp with a mineral aftertaste.

title: Azelia 2012  Barolo
description: Underbrush, toasted hazelnut, licorice and wild berry aromas lead the nose. The straightforward palate shows raw red cherry, orange peel and star anise alongside firm but refined tannins.

title: B Side 2014 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed in dried herb and cigar, this is a supple, round, high-toned wine, made from largely Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, with smaller additions of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Dolcetto. Red cherry dominates, almost like a kirsch, while the restrained oak makes it easy to enjoy now.

title: Barta 2012 Öreg Kiraly Dulo Mad Furmint (Tokaj)
description: Aromas of jasmine and honeysuckle entice your nose and flavors of lemon lime and apple cider excite your palate. This dry Hungarian Furmint has both a strong minerality and a crisp finish.

title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2013 Clos du Dessus des Marconnets  (Beaune)
description: While it is not a premier cru, this wine conveys many of the precise red-fruit flavors of the Les Marconnets vineyard just below on the slope. It is finely perfumed, with the softness typical of the northern Beaune vineyards. Vivid strawberry and red-cherry fruits are already delicious and ready to drink.

title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)
description: This is no basic white Burgundy. With balanced wood aging and ripe fruit, it is rich and full in the mouth. It has tense acidity as well as an almost honeyed character. The wood fits well into this wine along with final acidity. It is ready to drink.

title: Epiphany 2013 Stagecoach Vineyard Syrah (Napa Valley)
description: Big, black and bold, this burly wine from the mighty mountain where Stagecoach flourishes rumbles in smoky oak and leather. Tannins are grippy yet smoothly integrated enough to provide a plushness to the proceedings.

title: Expression 38 2013 Goldrock Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Soft and gentle in handfuls of rose petal and cardamom, this wine veers more savory than fruity, offering definite appeal to fans of a full-bodied yet more complex style. That exotic spiciness persists to the finish that adds length and breadth to the acidity.

title: Filus 2013 Reserve Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: Lightly volatile, balsamic aromas blend with cedary notes and berry scents. This feels round and fresh, which is typical of the Uco Valley. Blueberry, spiced plum and cassis flavors finish with chocolaty oak and mocha flavors as well as juicy acidity.
